items.q: In the board game 'Twilight Imperium', what central planet do players fight to control?
items.explanation: Controlling the former capital of the Lazax empire grants powerful tactical advantages.

items.q: The famous Konami Code was first used in the arcade game 'Contra'.
items.explanation: It was first used in the 1986 NES port of 'Gradius'.

items.q: In a standard game of chess, a player can legally promote a pawn into a second King.
items.explanation: A pawn can only be promoted to a Queen, Rook, Bishop, or Knight.

items.q: What notoriously difficult 1991 NES game tasks the player with riding a hoverbike over a deadly obstacle course?
items.explanation: The 'Turbo Tunnel' level is legendary for its extreme difficulty.

items.q: Who created the staggeringly successful sandbox game 'Minecraft' before selling it to Microsoft?
items.explanation: He founded Mojang Studios to develop the game.

items.q: What complex tabletop strategy game famously involves pushing hundreds of painted Space Marines across a table?
items.explanation: It is the most popular miniature wargame in the world.

items.q: In the card game 'Magic: The Gathering', what is the name of the incredibly rare, highly powerful card artifact that costs zero mana to cast?
items.explanation: It adds three mana of any single color to your mana pool.

items.q: What massive 2004 MMORPG was praised for its deep lore involving the Horde and the Alliance?
items.explanation: It remains a cultural touchstone in the gaming industry.

items.q: Which influential 1990 puzzle video game featured infectious Russian folk music playing as players cleared lines of blocks?
items.explanation: The 'Type A' music theme is based on the Russian song 'Korobeiniki'.

items.q: What highly acclaimed 2017 action-adventure game features Link waking up from a 100-year slumber in Hyrule?
items.a: The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild.
